      • showMessageDialog

        public int showMessageDialog(java.lang.String title,
                             java.lang.String message,
                             java.lang.String [] buttons,
                             boolean errorStyle,
                             java.awt.Window window,
                             int defaultOptionIndex,
                             int focusedOptionIndex,
                             DialogWrapper.DoNotAskOption doNotAskDialogOption)
        Description copied from class: MacMessages
        Buttons are placed starting near the right side of the alert and going toward the left side (for languages that read left to right). The first three buttons are identified positionally as NSAlertFirstButtonReturn, NSAlertSecondButtonReturn, NSAlertThirdButtonReturn in the return-code parameter evaluated by the modal delegate. Subsequent buttons are identified as NSAlertThirdButtonReturn +n, where n is an integer By default, the first button has a key equivalent of Return, any button with a title of "Cancel" has a key equivalent of Escape, and any button with the title "Don't Save" has a key equivalent of Command-D (but only if it is not the first button). http://developer.apple.com/library/mac/#documentation/Cocoa/Reference/ApplicationKit/Classes/NSAlert_Class/Reference/Reference.html Please, note that Cancel is supposed to be the last button!
        Specified by:
        showMessageDialog in class MacMessages
        Returns:
        number of button pressed: from 0 up to buttons.length-1 inclusive, or -1 for Cancel
